WRITING.TITLE: Ancestral blades
WRITING.TEXT:
In some some medieval fantasy universes, ASOIAF and LOTR etc, and some other "historically rooted" shows, swords are passed down through families for generations or from father to son.
How realistic is this, that a weapon would still function after all this time and say periodical use ?
Assuming the blade is not ceremonial.
Many thanks.

Hodor was "dumb" before bran was born. Bran can time travel but can not interact. People don't see him. We don't know that he can influence past events.

No I'm complaining that a game mechanic is pointless. Say the top score possible so far is x. Well then once you reach that you're on page 134 of the leaderboards among all the others who have the same score. Time isn't even taken into account. The leaderboards are pointless. They're just used as an excuse for the always online requirement.

I stated that in my post, my point is about the cameras. Why remove the evidence. It affects leaderboards which are ultimately pointless. Blodmoney actually had witnesses and evidence affect you in the game.
